intro: Drosanthemum floribundum, commonly known as the common waxflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to store water in its leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a favored ornamental plant in arid climates.
